title: How would someone of Noxian, Shuriman, Freljordian, etc. decent be treated living somewhere else?
body:
In this new crazy world being built for us, the inhabitant peoples are of very different cultures. I'm curious how you think emigrants or descendants of emigrants would be treated if they lived in another land. How would a Freljordian be treated in Demacia? What emigrants would even be allowed in Noxus? How about Yordles in Zaun, or Pilties in Ionia? Etc.

P.S. No salt please.

replies.body: A Zaunian scientist found in Noxus: Walks into the bar.. everyone stink eyes him. He pulls a concoction out of his pocket, throws it at the largest guy in the room. It explodes and disorients the guy. The scientist wallops the big guy so hard, blood runs through the scientists white glove. The noxians buy him a round. Pretty solid party.

Hi Solideus,
Fun post.
Just my thoughts on the first couple (my personal view):
I think you would be unlikely to find a Freljordian in Demacia, it's not the friendliest place to outsiders and it's not easy to get into.
I don't think Noxians are overly bothered about where you come fromâ€”it's what you bring with you that matters. 
Your average Noxian would be much more used to seeing people of great diversity than your everyday Demacian. This is partly due to the core of Noxian society being built on a rather aggressive meritocracy, so it's about what you can do or what you have. It's not about your name or your background. Though having a name like Du Couteau might at least get your foot in some rather heavy doors.

>I think you would be unlikely to find a Freljordian in Demacia, it's not the friendliest place to outsiders and it's not easy to get into.

Doesn't that have some fairly major implications for Shyvana?
It does. Though that certainly doesn't mean she can't be in Demacia, it just makes that decision even more controversial and speaks more to her and the prince's character.

I suppose it just exacerbates the whole "half-breed" issue in that people will also pick a bone with her for not being Demacian born as well as being half dragon.

Still curious as to where her lore takes place now since if Demacia and Noxus directly border Shurima, we're kinda lacking a Great Barrier where J4 would've gone to meet Shyvana, or we're not lacking it but there's a ravenous Rek'Sai between Demacia and the Barrier.

Shurima does not directly border Demacia and Noxus. Runeterra is a big world and Valoran is a rather large continent. The former Empire of Shurima was also massive, but it doesn't sit on Garen's doorstep, don't worry.
Ah ok, that helps explain stuff. Mind you I was hoping for a J4 and Shyvana rumble against Xer'Sai in Shurima story!
Never say never.

Well it is known that Shyvana doesn't feel exactly comfortable in Demacia. While Jarvan earned her respect during his misterious journey after his capture at the hand of Noxus (i suppose that is still canon) she just followed him out of loyalty. Shyvana always suffered the fact that she is a mixed blood, refused by the dragon kind and feared (and i suppose even respected in some certain degree) by humans for her ferocity. She has always been an interesting character on that point of view. It was also stated that Shyvana hates the fact she can't socialize with humans as easily as others could do, if you read LoLWiki you would know Shyvana envies people like Nidalee, capable of being both wild and human without any socializing problem. She's an outsider in Demacia, and though respected and feared she knows she will never be able to be able to feels like a proper human being like the rest of Demacians.
Who the hell would close a door on a Du Couteaus foot though.... That person would have one heck of a death wish!
I think it would be a) an accident and b) followed by profuse apologies. And then, maybe, a knife.
Profuse apologies, followed by profuse bleeding?

I'm inclined to agree with you. But only one knife? Such restraint!

If it would amuse you, what sort of welcome would you think a Bilgewater privateer would get in the Placidium?

How do you think people reacted to Shyvana when she arrived with Jarvan? She certainly stands out after all. Does she get a pass for arriving with Jarvan? Or maybe everyone has their eye on her because they don't trust her being so close to their prince...
So does that mean that there is not the huge yordle hatred of noxians that did not make too much sense in old lore?

Noxus was a bit more cut and dry in the past. Noxian assassins are certainly still part of the reality of Noxus, but seeing it wholesale as "evil" isn't really a valid perspective. Though there are folks from Ionia that would rightly argue with me.
Awesome, Noxus is probably my favourite faction and am happy that Riot is continueing to fix the current bad rap that noxians get.

That makes sense! So I guess Noxus would accept pretty much anyone who could prove themselves, even Yordles. Taking in refugees, maybe not so much. 

Depending on how their ideology has looked historically, it potentially brings in some interesting possibilities around "ethnic families" in Noxus. There could be barbarian-decent families or districts with a distinct sub-culture within Noxus. Other "ethnicities" would be even more interesting; how would descendants of Demacian defectors live in Noxus, and what would their flavor of sub-culture be like? There's lots of possibilities for descendants from various other nations. I bet a lot of less savory types from other places would have chosen to move to Noxus, which might lead "pure" Noxians to be a bit distrustful, even if accommodating, to immigrant-descended Noxians.

I suppose that Noxus could easily grant refugees a safe haven, providing that these people could actually help Noxus society as well. Imagine if Olaf and his clan migrated from Lokfar for some reason and needed land or just a place to live outside the Freljord. Noxus could easily grant some shelter to the Lokfarian and their most famous Bro-serker but only because for their fame as fearsome shock troops, meaning that such an intake of outsiders could mean a benefit for the noxian society as whole (the noxian army in this case).

Refugees are seldom in a position of power, which is why I don't think refugees, in general, would be something Noxus took in. Incorporating war-bands, mercenaries or tribes is another matter, though!
Personally i always felt Noxus gave some sort of Mandalorian-ish feel. You're good? Wanna join? No problem.

I've wondered about the Noxian "might makes right" ideals; how _do_ Noxians view the cloak-and-dagger approach as opposed to a face-to-face fight? If a mountain of a Noxian turns his back and is struck down by an opportune assassin, is that viewed as "fair"?

How about magic, which I assume often would be blood magic in Noxus? Brawn vs. magic, what's the ideal?

Is deception an acceptable tactic to express your might? 

Is there no "code of conduct" element to the Noxian way; is a group of armed Noxians striking down a weak and unarmed Noxian still in the right, are they never looked down upon for "cheating"?

wouldn't galio also be considered a outsider in demacian society since he is artificially created life even tho hes a patriot for his country wouldn't there be some people in demacia be very critical of him not being natural compared to others in demacia?

Noxians I believe would be initially distrusful, if not outright hostile towards outsiders and non-humans....only at first at least.  Once an individual either proved themselves as strong, capable, or somehow of use to Noxus I think they would likely be accepted.  That said, Noxians would NEVER accept refugee's unless they were their own citizens.

Demacia at first would seem more accepting, less open hostility and refugee's would of course be cared for openly...but for those trying to live their they would likely find MANY doors for advancement would be completely closed to them because of Demacia's caste system.  Not only would they lack a family name to rise to a position of importance they would also lack natural Demacian birth

Zaun and Piltover are both likely progressive enough that all people would be welcomed, though in Zaun outsiders would likely be more at risk of the Mega-corporations penchant for abduction

Bilgewater is pirate town, anyone and everyone is welcomed unless they are trying to restrict their freedoms.

Bandle City at least would be welcoming to visitors, but im not sure how they would be about non-yordle permanent residents.  Rumble proves there is a portion of the population that dislikes the big-folk

Freljord would depend on the tribe you tried to join, Sejuani is the more traditionalist, she would likely turn away newcomers, while Ashe would be more inclusive

Ionia it would depend on the reason and the individuals involved.  Most parties would likely be welcomed, but encouraged to adopt their beliefs on balance.  Noxian migrants however would face significant opposition.

I think most citizens from other countries would be treated rather poorly in Noxus(even zaun,I mean the regular noxian soldiers were probably not happy about getting bombed by zaunite weapons too),unless this person proved him/herself.

In demacia you might be tolerated a bit more if you aren't from noxus or zaun,but they might still have prejudices against you and don't expect to be able to get a high position in the military.

my personal opinion on this matter (yes i know its VERY old. happened to stumble on it)
i rekon it would be dependant on the people. e.g. noxus/demacia are rivals i believe so that probably wouldnt go so well
but say maybe freljord-ionia might be a bit more peacefull (key word MIGHT i dont know especialy considering next point)
and lastly if you consider real life. with how large the human population is getting we are starting to get a large amount of "race diversity/mixing" so to speak. but at the same time there is still a LOT of racism and races not mixing.

so i believe it would be similar to our human way of "gelling together" but on a "less friendly" manner as they are majority in separate "factions" with a few "wanderers"

thats what i think on the matter
hope you like my thoughts and sorry if i worded anything wrong xD

It is just so awesome to see you post again Jaredan, and this time you acctually seem to have something to tell us as well! 

I will actually start hoping for lore in the next months from now on, but alas, on to my question.

How are Noxians treated in the outside world, are they completely shut off due to their aggressive nature, or are they accepted as individuals as they are in Noxus, this questions also goes for Demacians, since no Demacian would normally accept a Yordle in to their country of tall handsome men and women (except for poppy because you DONT FIGHT WITH POPPY)  how are they treated then traveling abroad.

Do people see them as evil, good, ignorant?

You seem to not have used Reply, I hope Jaredan still sees your comment! 
Judging from Rek'Sai's teaser Noxus doesn't seem like a shut-in nation, at least. Their aggressive expansionism lead them outward; their imposive strength might encourage others to be accommodating.

I feel like in Zaun no one cares who or what you are as long as you aren't from piltover. You could be a giant bat that only speaks in haikus and they would be like, "Sup? wanna shoot up mana potions?"
I wonder if Leona would be welcome in Demacia due to her holy powers...
Demacia would put them in the filth like the peasants.
I think that Ionia wouldn't welcome Noxian's very warmly, unless that person demonstrated true Ionian ideals of balance.

I think it just depends on what country you move too and who your talking with . Like if you were in Demcia and move to Noxsus there either going to be people that hate you instantly or like you for choosing to side with Noxsus
